title: How to Use These Reference Tools

content.intro:

sections.title: The Spiritual Practice of Quick Reference
sections.content:

It's what you bring to them.

**When you grab your phone to check a protocol**â€”that's you choosing to serve with precision.

sections.title: How to Use This Section
items: **Scan quickly**: These pages are built for speed. Bullet points, checklists, step-by-step guides.
**Bookmark what matters**: Save your most-used references for instant access on your phone.
**Print if helpful**: Some volunteers prefer paper copies clipped to their lanyards.
**Trust your training**: These tools support your knowledgeâ€”they don't replace it.
**Return when needed**: You don't need to memorize everything. That's why these exist.

sections.title: A Reminder About Mastery
sections.content:
Mastery isn't about never needing to look things up.

Mastery is knowing when to reference your tools, when to trust your training, and when to improvise with wisdom.

The volunteer who checks the protocol mid-task isn't less skilled than the one who remembers it by heart. They're both serving with integrity.

Use these tools freely. There's no shame in double-checking. There's only the commitment to getting it right.

sections.title: Ready When You Need Them
sections.content:
These reference pages are always hereâ€”before your first event, during intense moments, after long shifts when your brain is tired.

Your job isn't to be perfect. Your job is to show up, stay grounded, and serve with heart.

These tools are here to help you do exactly that.
